main event: A bright red and white object, about the size of a 3/4 degree star, was observed for 2 minutes moving at an estimated speed of 1,500 mph and altitude above 20,000 feet in Schenectady, New York.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be 3/4 degree in diameter.
The object covered a distance over 3 minutes, indicating a speed of around 1,500 mph.
The object was brighter than the brightest stars in the sky.
The edges of the object were sharply outlined.
The object was observed to suddenly speed up and change direction.
sighted object: a bright red and white object
